text: maserati pyramid of the sun
well hello everybody anthony fantana
here the internet's busiest music nerd
and we're going to review an album from
a georgia band maserati never again will
i intro a video in a faux southern
accent anyway guys um before i get into
this review
i want to mention that something
atrocious happened on my last review
someone named channel shannon commented
saying that i should review the new
kesha album
and over 40 of you thumbed it up why do
you hurt me i say that because i just
got back from the doctors an hour ago
had a physical
and my doctor dr mangum said that i am
allergic to kesha and i am not to under
any circumstances listened to her music
ever he even gave me this note excusing
me from reviewing the new kesha album
if you're down with instrumental rock if
you're down with post rock maserati is
definitely a band you should spend a
little bit of time with their early work
has all of the subtleties all of the
slow builds that i've come to appreciate
in this kind of music but i would be
lying if i said i felt it was stand out
in 2007 the band really changed up their
sound though with inventions for the new
season which just kind of stopped all
the subtleties out of the mix got rid of
the slow builds screw all that let's
give the people rifts let's give them
beats it was a more accessible direction
but i can't exactly say it was really
accessing me i know this is when the
band really started to gain some
notoriety gained some attention but
still a lot of the riffs on this lp kind
of felt a little monotonous to me very
repetitive kind of like i was running in
circles as i was listening to it but
this my friends pyramid of the sun is
really where the band has begun to
impress me last year these guys dropped
a split with one of my favorite bands
zombie and i really didn't think much of
it however i could totally see zombies
worship of synthesizers and effects
having a huge
impact on what maserati has done here
zombie member steve moore is actually
featured on this album a lot and he
brings some really really amazing synth
textures to the table and gives maserati
a
gargantuan epicness that they just did
not have before to me that maserati
sound on inventions combined with that
zombie sound on the album spirit animal
has kind of resulted in something that
sounds like a more rock oriented version
of what kraut rock bands like tangerine
dream were doing on albums such as
rubycon in all respects i think this
thing is a huge improvement upon what
they did on their 2007 album
the production is better the guitars are
sharp as hell they wail like a banshee
the base is warm the drums snap like a
carrot there's more sound here more
effects more texture the repetitive
riffs are still here for the most part
but they've been kind of relegated to
the background and they are keeping
tempo they're keeping the groove they're
not the main focus like they used to be
now what's kind of stealing the show for
me are all of the bubbling synthesizers
are all of the effects that the guitars
are soaked in there are some points here
where i feel a little underwhelmed
that's really my only gripe and most of
these parts only occur in the first half
of this album i'm thinking moments like
the title track for example that to me
maybe could be a little more subtle
maybe could draw the builds out a little
bit more i like surprises in my
instrumental rock what can i say that's
just me i'm just that kind of guy yeah
you know i'm feeling a strong 7 to a
light 8 on this lp it's fantastic stuff
but before i close this review out i
have to mention one thing the man
playing drums on this album
passed away in the midst of recording
this lp drummer jerry fox is no longer
with us and it's very sad to
see maserati lose an extremely pivotal
part of their makeup at a point that i
think is probably their greatest however
i am in some way at least kind of
pleased to see that some of jerry's
final recordings were a fantastic
showcase of his talents his abilities
and just his
sixth sense for rhythms you will be
missed uh you guys if you're a fan of
maserati or if this is your first taste
let me know what you think of this album
do you love it do you hate it
why do you think this is maserati's most
shining moment and where do you think
the band goes from here musically also
throw me some ideas for future reviews
as well
anthony fantano
also throw me some ideas for future
reviews as well
maserati
pyramid of the sun
forever
you
